title: Ticket #536: If a config problem causes a starter to crash, there is no notice
description:
Problem:

If you update a condor config, and make an error, the condor daemons will continue to run, but when the starter tries to start it fails immediately. There is no notice to indicate there is a problem. There should be some notice made.

Where this came up:

In CHTC I missed a '\' on one line, after pusing out the config change on a test node, I saw the daemons were continueing to run (The automatic condor_reconfig failed because of the config error, but I missed that in the noise from cfengine).

If I would have executed one client utility I would have seen my error, but I didn't. There was no messages from condor letting me know that starters were dying.

Despite my errors, I talked it over with DanB and it certainly sounds like we should give some kind of notice if starters are immediately dying, so I made this ticket.
